technologies.caption: HTML is a markup language used to structure and organize content on the web.
CSS is a style sheet language used to design, layout, and visually enhance web pages.
JavaScript is a programming language that enables interactive, dynamic, and functional web experiences.
React is a JavaScript library for building fast, scalable, and component-based user interfaces.
Node.js allows JavaScript to run on the server for building scalable backend applications.
Express is a lightweight Node.js framework used to build REST APIs and web servers.
MongoDB is a NoSQL database designed for flexible, scalable, and high-performance data storage.
Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building modern user interfaces.
Git is a version control system used to track code changes and collaborate efficiently.
Docker enables developers to package applications into containers for consistent deployments.
